summary: This is an email chain from June 25, 2020, discussing plans for victim notification in the Epstein case. It outlines a two-tiered notification strategy: phone calls to attorneys for a small group of statutory victims, and written letters to a larger group of Epstein victims. The discussion involves coordination between prosecutors and victim services.

persons.name: VSD
persons.context: The email chain is about scheduling a call with VSD to discuss victim notification procedures. VSD is part of the coordination effort.

events.title: Scheduled call on victim notification
events.description: A call is scheduled for 10:30 AM to discuss victim notification procedures for the Epstein case, involving prosecutors and victim services.

keyFacts: The document reveals a planned two-tiered victim notification strategy: phone calls to attorneys for statutory victims and written letters to a larger group of Epstein victims.
The notification plan aims to avoid confusion and specifies that most victims are represented by counsel, influencing the communication method.
The email indicates coordination between prosecutors (AUSAs) and victim services (VSD) to manage victim notifications for the Epstein indictment.
